review_title: Amazing people with an amazing approach to honoring and celebrating our elders!
pros: Supporting environment with good people - very warm and accepting Innovative approaches to senior living - creating a caring community/citizenship model Scholarships offered to clinical team members Lots of promotional opportunities Caring supervisors - very professional and helpful - mentoring program
cons: While I appreciate the critical needs fund for employee hardships, I wish it was easier to access.

pros: The office was new and nice and easy access from I-25
cons: Very narrow minded thinkers at the top of the company. Not all all welcoming of new ideas or able to think for current times, let alone the future. Backwards, hypocritical and micro-managers. Good riddance.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Denver, CO
pros: * Management listens and cares * Wage is above average * High sense of "Team" * Facility is nice and kept up
cons: * Communication often falls through the cracks * Bad employees are tolerated—probably because the industry is desperate * Christian Living Communities does not give performance raises so everyone gets the same raise whether you do a good job or not * Embrace non-Christian values even though we are "Christian Living Communities"....Just take the Christian out of it so that you can be true to your name

job_title: Cheif Operating Officer in Denver, CO
pros: So...I'm the COO, so of course I'm going to give a raving review! What I can say is that we put people first. We understand that it takes great people to provide great care and services to those who call our communities home. Many organizations say they're a mission-driven organization, but are they really? I can say with 100% certainty that CLC is! Our mission and our vision is VERY important to us, and we're ready to raise the bar in senior living with YOU on our team. Will you join us in creating communities where aging is honored and celebrated?
cons: Residents want to build relationships. If you want to just be an order-taker and not get to know people and their preferences, perhaps this isn't the job for you. Residents what to share their stories and learn more about you and support you. Everyone wants the same goal. However, if you're not up for showing up on time or being your best self, maybe you should keep looking.

review_title: I just can't quit CLC, It's that good!
job_title: Vice President of Human Resources in Denver, CO
pros: I have been with CLC for over 30 years, and have grown with the company into my current role. I started out in Dining Services, became a CNA, worked in Finance, Payroll and Accounting and landed in HR. The support CLC has given me in my career growth and the feeling of belonging at the organization has had enormous impact on my life! Yes, I have been approached by recruiters elsewhere, but I just can't quit CLC, it's that good!
cons: We are all human, we make mistakes and we learn from them. My hope is that anyone with a negative experience with CLC understands that one persons actions and behavior doesn't speak for the entire organization. We are all here to support one another to create communities where aging is honored and celebrated.

review_title: 16 Years and Still Enjoying My Work!
job_title: Director of Talent Acquisition in Englewood, CO
pros: I've stayed at CLC because the culture is truly caring and compassionate. Not only do I feel valued by my supervisor, he also encourages us to take risks and have fun with how we can always be growing! When we grow personally and professionally, the organization and our residents and team members see the benefits!
cons: Working for a not-for-profit sometimes means we need to be creative to find ways to get things done.

pros:
Supportive Executive Team. Good mission and vision.
PTO
Benefits
cons:
High level of stress
Little Work/Life Balance

job_title: Resident Care Partner in Denver, CO
pros: Leaders and managers genuinely care about staff. Those of us who provide direct care to residents are especially appreciated. We got a pay raise even when times were tough last year. The leaders at the EPSO make it a priority to care with support, raises, recognition and I even got a hand written card from the VP of HR to say thank you. No one does it better.
cons: There are times when we are short staffed and have to work long hours. Connections are bad and my cell phone mostly doesn't work in the building. I wish they would fix that

pros: Friendly staff, highly accessible management
cons: Low pay, poor work life balance, no privacy

pros: Nice physical environment, strong on-site leadership.
cons: A lot but it is unlikely to change.

job_title: Business Development Marketing Manager in Greenwood Village, CO
pros: The company promotes personal and career growth
cons: Not really a con, but this past year has been very difficult for the senior care industry.

job_title: Executive Director, Non-Profit in Centennial, CO
pros: Celebrates Aging, progressive in their approaches, industry leaders.
cons: Tremendous organizational changes in past 18 months - still trying to work through that, but they will do so successfully.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Aurora, CO
pros: Management cares about employees, pay is competitive
cons: Night shift gets overlooked sometimes

job_title: Corporate Volunteer Manager in Tulsa, OK
pros: Excellent company to work for.
cons: Loss of elders can be hard.

pros: The residents and (most) of their family members.
cons:
Administration is horrid!    They give lip-service to their Eden Alternative tenets.  They treat their employees like indentured servants.  It's no wonder that the only long-time employees are from ethnic groups that never question authority.
Most administrators have either never been nurses, or only have been in low-level roles. (Don't have a working knowledge of being on a fast-paced, demanding sub-acute unit). Therefore, they have unrealistic expectations of the nurse on a sub-acute unit.
The attrition rate on the sub-acute floor is sky-high:  12 nurses in 2 years!!!!

pros: Some of the residents are very lovable
cons: Manager discretion is favoritism.

pros: Great people to work with. Amazing community with awesome residents. Competitive pay and benefits. Make you feel Valued as an employee.
cons: Like most places of Employment, sometimes have a high turnover. Tend to overdo the workload dork just one person.

review_title: Great and fulfilling work, management struggles
pros: Working with the residents no matter the position is so rewarding and you can learn a lot
cons: The management can be rude and abrasive, or they may simply never be able to be found

pros: Great mission/values; passionate leadership; awesome team members
cons: Low pay (similar across the industry - a lot of talk about getting pay “beyond the paycheck” for doing good work, but that can’t pay bills)

pros: The residents and facility as well as the pay.
cons: Management, no support, can't voice anything even if it was better for everyone involved.

pros: Flexible schedule, friendly appreciative clients, beautiful communities
cons:
Inconsistent schedule in Homecare,  too many short shifts, recent company wide benefit cuts,
suites of Someren Glen was a hostile work environment

pros: Decent pay scale compared to other healthcare companies
cons: Rhythms was a horrible company to work for. The office staff are completely unethical and underhanded, manipulative, will mock and bully their staff, play favorites all the time and some display racist tendencies. They will also throw eachother under the bus if you don't fit in.

pros:

Working with the residents is great

No matching retirement benefits
They do not value work life balance

Paper charting
